meanings.sent1: It is axiomatic that the sun rises in the east.
meanings.sent2: The fact that water freezes at 0 degrees Celsius is axiomatic.
meanings.sent3: It's axiomatic that cats will always land on their feet.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was axiomatic, like a beacon of light in a dark world.
meanings.sent5: The axiomatic truth of gravity keeps us grounded on Earth.

meanings.definition: Based on or involving an axiom
meanings.sent1: The axiomatic proof of the theorem left no room for doubt.
meanings.sent2: His argument was axiomatic, built upon solid mathematical principles.
meanings.sent3: The axiomatic nature of the equation made it easy to solve.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to leave was axiomatic, following the logic of her heart.
meanings.sent5: The axiomatic foundation of the theory ensured its validity.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to or resembling an axiom
meanings.sent1: The axiomatic structure of the building was evident in its symmetry.
meanings.sent2: His speech had an axiomatic quality, clear and logical.
meanings.sent3: The axiomatic pattern of the design made it visually appealing.
meanings.sent4: Her axiomatic approach to problem-solving impressed her colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The axiomatic connection between the two ideas was undeniable.
